loginPage.title: Login
loginPage.signUpMessage: Sign up now, it's free and easy! Discover thousands of games and connect with new friends worldwide.

payment.vatInfo: All prices include VAT where applicable
payment.agreeTerms: I agree to the terms of the
payment.kakaoPayNotice: KakaoPay transactions are authorized through the Smart2Pay website. Click the button below to open a new web browser to initiate the transaction.
payment.confirmationEmail: Confirmation will be emailed to your address at gmail.com
payment.purchaseDescription: Once you've completed this transaction, your payment method will be debited, and you'll receive an email message confirming receipt of your purchase.
payment.errorNoToken: Token is missing. Please log in again.
payment.errorDuringPurchase: An error occurred during the payment preparation:
payment.errorPurchaseFailed: Payment preparation failed. Please try again.

paymentCancellation.refundInfo: The payment has been successfully cancelled, and the payment amount will be refunded.

paymentSuccess.successMessage: The purchased game has been registered to your account. You can now enjoy it anytime from your Steam library.

privacyPolicy.title: Privacy Policy
privacyPolicy.intro: Valve respects the privacy of its online visitors and customers of its products and services and complies with applicable laws for the protection of your privacy, including, without limitation, the California Consumer Privacy Act ("CCPA"), the European Union General Data Protection Regulation ("GDPR") and the UK GDPR.
privacyPolicy.dpf: Valve and its subsidiary TR Technical Inc. comply with the EU-U.S. Data Privacy Framework (EU-U.S. DPF), the UK Extension to the EU-U.S. DPF, and the Swiss-U.S. Data Privacy Framework (Swiss-U.S. DPF) as set forth by the U.S. Department of Commerce.

section1.title: 1. Definitions
section1.content: Wherever we talk about personal data ("Personal Data"), we mean any information that can either itself identify you as an individual ("Personally Identifying Information").

section2.title: 2. Why Valve Collects and Processes Data
section2.content: Valve collects and processes Personal Data for the following reasons:
section2.itemA: a) Where it is necessary for the performance of an agreement with you.
section2.itemB: b) Where it is necessary for compliance with legal obligations.
section2.itemC: c) Where it is necessary for the purposes of the legitimate and legal interests of Valve or third parties.
section2.itemD: d) Where you have given consent to the processing of your Personal Data for one or more specific purposes.
section2.summary: These reasons for collecting and processing data determine and limit what Personal Data we collect and how we use it.

section3.title: 3. The Types and Sources of Data We Collect

subsection1.title: 3.1 Basic Account Data
subsection1.content: When setting up an Account, Valve will collect your email address and country of residence, among other information.

subsection2.title: 3.2 Transaction and Payment Data
subsection2.content: In order to make a transaction on Steam, you may need to provide payment data to Valve to enable the transaction.

subsection3.title: 3.3 Other Data You Explicitly Submit
subsection3.content: We will collect and process Personal Data whenever you explicitly provide it to us or send it.
subsection3.item1: Information that you post, comment or follow in any of our Content and Services.
subsection3.item3: Information you provide when you request information or support from us.
subsection3.item4: Information you provide to us when participating in competitions, contests or tournaments.

subsection4.title: 3.4 Your Use of the Steam Client and Websites
subsection4.content: We collect a variety of information through your general interaction with the websites, Content and Services offered by Steam.

subsection5.title: 3.5 Your Use of Games and Other Subscriptions
subsection5.content: In order to provide you with services, we record and store information about your activity in our Content and Services.

subsection6.title: 3.6 Tracking Data and Cookies
subsection6.content: We use "Cookies", which are text files placed on your computer, and similar technologies to help us analyze how users use our services.

termsOfUse.title: Legal Notice
termsOfUse.copyrightContent: Â© 2024 Valve Corporation. All rights reserved. Valve, the Valve logo, Half-Life, the Half-Life logo, the Lambda logo, Steam, the Steam logo, Team Fortress, the Team Fortress logo, Opposing Force, Day of Defeat, the Day of Defeat logo, Counter-Strike, the Counter-Strike logo, Source, the Source logo, Counter-Strike: Condition Zero, Portal, the Portal logo, Dota, the Dota 2 logo, and Defense of the Ancients are trademarks and/or registered trademarks of Valve Corporation. All other trademarks are property of their respective owners.
termsOfUse.thirdPartyContent: Steam and other Valve products distributed via Steam use certain third party materials that require notifications about their license terms. You can find a list of these notifications in the file called ThirdPartyLegalNotices.doc distributed with the Steam client and/or a particular Valve product. Where license terms require Valve to make source code available for redistribution, the code may be found here. Some geospatial data on this website is provided by geonames.org
termsOfUse.copyrightInfringementContent: Valve respects the intellectual property rights of others, and we ask that everyone using our internet sites and services do the same. Anyone who believes that their work has been reproduced in one of our internet sites or services in a way that constitutes copyright infringement may notify Valve via this page.
termsOfUse.copyrightLink: More information about U.S. copyright law can be found at the United States Copyright Office.
